basics.name: Ferenc Gozony
basics.label: Concept Artist / Level Designer
basics.summary: Game Artist looking to provide passionate and detailed work while earning hands-on experience in AAA studios. Currently pursuing a B.S. in Game Design & Interactive Media at UCI, graduating March 2026.

work.name: BranchOut, Inc.
work.summary: Organized UI/UX market research with a team of 7 ambassadors, leading user interviews and translating insights into an improved UI flow and better user experience. Additionally, I also worked closely with the product owner to optimize system design and interaction loop through gamification.

work.name: Gozony Legal Nurse Consulting
work.summary: Assisting in file organization, billing, and advertisement, I prepared case files, invoiced clients and documented receipts on Quickbooks, and created logos, business cards, labels and Word templates, as well as a custom website in Wix (www.gozonylnc.com).

work.name: SECO-LARM, USA.
work.summary: Created digital, print, and social media marketing content that was featured in B2B markets nationwide. Collaborated with international manufacturers to create brand-compliant marketing materials worldwide. Worked Full-Time over a 3 month period while Sr. Designer was on maternity leave, taking on product photography, screen printing, and organizational duties.

projects.name: Chronomancy (Game)
projects.summary: As Art Director for this project, I'm currently managing a team of 8 talented artists while defining the game's visual style through the creation of character and environment concept art.

projects.name: Project: Ether
projects.summary: Contributed towards rigging, animation, and texture debugging over the course of 2 weeks before this project's shipping date. A quick summary of my work involved identifying, documenting, and resolving animation and texture-related issues impacting gameplay and performance.

projects.name: Convergence
projects.summary: As Lead Artist, I designed our sprites and particle-based VFX to adapt to the challenges of a constantly scaling canvas, maintaining visual clarity and supporting our narrative theme in an ever-changing particle simulation.

education.area: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)
education.studyType: B.S in Game Design and Interactive Media

references.name: Christina Bartel
references.reference: Supervisor at Gozony Legal Nurse Consulting

references.name: James Hollifield
references.reference: Senior Graphic Designer for SECO-LARM, USA.
